On 4/20/06, Lyle Kopnicky <lyle@...> wrote:
> One could argue that a=
 cart /is/ a session.  In fact, for a shopping
> application, that's pretty=
 much what I consider the session to consist
> of.  Therefore, the referenc=
e to the back end cart is a session key.

Not necessarily.  The equivalent =
of a cart for a travel broker is an
itinerary or trip.  I can set one up bu=
t not book it, come back later
(another "session") and book it, come back s=
till later (yet another
session) and add a hotel etc.

I don't know that an=
ybody does it this way, but the same could happen
to a shopping cart.  Pick=
 some items, come back later and pick some
more, come back still later and =
check out.
